> I have been playing around with the timeout-settings trying in order
> to speed up site aquisition.  I've set the <integer

It seems that you need to change the politeness of the crawl. Please see section on politeness
(6.4.3.1.) in the user manual. User manual is at crawler.archive.org
(http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html)
Let us know if we can help more.

> name="timeout-seconds">5</integer> to allow only 5 seconds for each
> resource.  It seems that the fetcher is not stopping after 5 seconds.
>  I'm crawling a site with large mp3's and each mp3 is definatley
> taking more than 5 seconds to time out.  Any thoughts?

timeout-seconds should give up on a connection after the limit is reached (btw, this in not a good 
way to 'speed up' a crawl.) If this is not working then it is a bug. I will take a look at it.
What version of Heritrix are you using?

Take care.
i.
